result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather D. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: For conditions, see Deferred Prosecution Agreement filed 3/11/15.

Pay costs. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Same conditions as ordered in 14CM449.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Heather D. Smith in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM23 (Plea/sentencing), 14CM449 (VIP Revoked, Sentencing today)
1:46 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

BY THE COURT:   Court finds the defendant guilty of 14CM449 Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 

15CM29 - Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM23.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
30 days jail on each count, concurrent with each other - STAYED -
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months on each count, concurrent:
Pay all costs of these actions, unless the costs in 14CM449 were paid. 
Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge (on 15CM23 only).
Obtain a AODA and comply with treatment recommendations, if treatment or counseling recommendations are found appropriate, then she is required to follow thru with them. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with any counseling or treatment recommendations that might be determined necessary and appropriate by her agent.

8:39 a.m. Defendant Heather D. Smith in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to revoke VIP agreements. Cases 14CM449 and 15CM23. Victim rights were complied with by the State. BTC: Granted - VIP is revoked.
to Vacate Deferred Prosecution Agreement and VIP Agreement
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing at 08-12-2015 08:30 am

ADDRESS INFO for Heather D. Smith
Current: 2601 Indiana Avenue, Apt 39, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 03-25-2015)
Prior: 2125 Fremont Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Heather D. Smith in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CM449, 15CM23
9:14 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State files Deferred Prosecution Agreement in 15CM23.
State files VIP Assessment and Recommendations in 14CM449.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CM449 Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 14CM449 Count 2.  Clerk directed to WITHHOLD Judgment of Conviction.
14CM449 Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Court questions defendant re: the DPA in 15CM23.
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the agreements. 
Both matters are deferred for 9 months.  Obligations have been reduced to writing.  If she does not comply with the terms of those agreements, then the State can ask for a plea in the newer case and ask for a judgment in the earlier case. 

Atty Constable makes statements indicating the conditions mirror each other.  It is the intent to serve 30 hours total community service, not 30 hours on each file.  Pay a fine of $50 plus costs in 15CM23.  

Conditions are added as stated by the district attorney. 
BY THE COURT:  Court has signed the agreements.
Status conference on March 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
$500 sig bond: Comply with all conditions in 14CM449.

Defendant Heather D. Smith in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
BTC:  $500 sig bond: Comply with all conditions in 14CM449.  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
